div.p: Working together in a peaceful way

div.h3: Kindergarten Registration – Do you have a child who will be 5 years old on or before September 1, 2020? If yes, please click on the link below to fill out a brief form to request registration information. Once submitted, you will be contacted by one of our office staff regarding the next steps for registration.

PreKindergarten Interest Form – Do you have a child who will be 3 or 4 years old on or before September 1, 2020? Are you interested in having your child attend PreK? If yes, please click on the link below to fill out a brief form. Once submitted, you will be contacted by one of our staff regarding the next steps.
Please click on the calendar for our learning and meal schedules for April 2020.
Please click on the calendar for our learning and meal schedules for May 2020.

Please read the following documents from our Superintendent, Dr. Julie Brown, regarding School, Meal, and Remote Learning information. As always, we will continue to update you with as much information as possible as it comes available. Thank you!
School information update, click here —-> https://bit.ly/2WkSLYi

h3.strong: Pontiac-William Holliday District #105 Closed Through End Of Year

div.h3: Effective Monday, March 16, 2020 through the end of the school year, schools in District 105 will be closed. This action is being done as a result of a directive from Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker. By closing our campuses, we hope to help in preventing the potential spread of COVID 19.

All classes as well as before- and after-school activities and events are cancelled during this closure. Organizations that use District 105 for their activities will not be able to hold those activities until further notice. Organized practice or activities should not take place on our campuses.

h3.strong: RESOURCES FOR USE DURING SCHOOL CLOSING

div.h3: Please use these resources for online and ‘unplugged’ activities for your children during the school closing. There are grade specific resources, movement activities, and other information to help your children and families during this closure. We will be adding and updating resources as they come available so please check back often. Your children’s teachers will be in contact with you to help get you started and work with you throughout the closing. Dr. Julie Brown will continue to update everyone via the usual channels on any new information.

h3.strong: Jr High Physical Education Teacher Wanted

div.h3: Pontiac Jr High is seeking a Jr High Physical Education Teacher. Please click HERE for more information.
div.p: We would like to congratulate Robin Ibel as District 105’s recipient of the Emerson Excellence In Teaching Award. Robin was nominated by several of her colleagues. She has been with District 105 since 2006 in different roles, most currently as an interventionist.
Robin’s colleagues mentioned the following when recommending her as this year’s award recipient:

“She leads by example. When she comes to you about a student that’s not quite hitting the target, I know with full confidence that she’s looked at every single piece of data, thought about every angle, and has taken the time to acquire background knowledge of the student. Robin oversees a lot of students within our building as our RTI specialist and must work with many parents, teachers, and students. She does a wonderful job of coordinating and communicating so everyone is on the same page.”

“Robin demonstrates an extraordinary commitment to the Pontiac – William Holliday community as well as supporting staff members with instructional ideas and materials to meet the needs of all students. Robin discerns quickly the individual needs of students and moves efficiently to provide recommendations and support for these students.”

“Robin makes outstanding connections with her students. She gets them excited about learning and celebrates each individual success. She makes sure to meet the needs of each and every individual in her care, often going so far as to restock her book shelves according to their individual reading preferences, so they enjoy learning and build confidence as a reader. She encourages them to always give their best, often checking up on them long after they have been in her program.”
“Robin is continually finding ways to grow as an educator. She spends most of her off hours researching new ideas and listening to webinars.”
“Her patience and understanding of students is never ending.”

These are just a few of the comments, but what stood out in each and every one was Robin’s commitment to students and the strong relationships she establishes. Congratulations Robin, the award is well deserved!
div.h3: District 105 is once again hosting school wide ‘Walk to School Days’ to encourage healthy and active lifestyles. On these days, our goal is to get more students and families walking or biking to school. Please click HERE for the flyer, walk to school dates, and drop off information.
Belleville Schools Transportation is now hiring drivers. If you are interested, please apply in person at 2012 Mascoutah Ave, Belleville, IL 62220.

div.div: Dating back to the first Pontiac school in 1861, School District #105 has a rich history in the state of Illinois. Find out more about our history, the area we serve, and read our handbook!
